isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - OIL COOLER HEADER ASSEMBLY (I-6), REPLACE

step1.para: Drain engine coolant and engine oil.
Disconnect oil feed supply line from oil filter header. Remove and discard tube nut O-ring. Cap fitting on header.
Disconnect the oil cooler water inlet tube and bracket from crankcase.
Remove bolts retaining oil cooler header to crankcase. Remove oil cooler header assembly. Discard O-rings, gaskets and seals.

note.para: If oil cooler is to be repaired, prior to disassembly of oil cooler, perform "Oil Cooler Leakage Test."

step1.para: Remove water outlet tube. Discard O-rings.
Remove, inspect and install pressure regulator valve located in crankcase. Replace if necessary.

note.para: In the event of bearing failure, the oil cooler bundle must be replaced because failed bearing debris cannot be removed from cooler bundle.
Use all new O-rings, gaskets and seals on installation.

step1.para: Install water outlet tube in front cover.
Install oil cooler assembly to the crankcase. Torque bolts to specifications.
Connect oil cooler water inlet tube and bracket to crankcase.
Connect oil feed supply line to oil filter heater. Use a new sealing ring at the oil inlet tube nut.
Fill engine coolant and engine oil.
Start engine, check for leaks. Top off engine coolant. Recheck oil level, add if necessary.
